title: U.S. per capita consumption of fresh fruit by fruit type 2018
summary: This bar chart has 11 columns on the x axis representing Fruits, and Per capita consumption in pounds in each Fruits on the y axis.
The maximum Per capita consumption in pounds 28.2 is found at Fruits Bananas and the minimum is found at Cherries where Fruits is 1.3.
The minimum Fruits Cherries has got 21.69 times less Per capita consumption in pounds than the maximum Fruits Bananas.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Fruits in the x axis and Per capita consumption in pounds in the y axis.
The maximum Per capita consumption in pounds 28.2 is found at Fruits Bananas and the minimum is found at Cherries where Fruits is 1.3.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 11 columns on the x axis representing Fruits, and Per capita consumption in pounds in each Fruits on the y axis.

max_summary: This bar chart has 11 columns on the x axis representing Fruits, and Per capita consumption in pounds in each Fruits on the y axis.
The Per capita consumption in pounds is appeared to be the highest at Fruits Bananas and lowest at Fruits Cherries.
The second highest Per capita consumption in pounds is appeared to be the Fruits Apples.
The highest Fruits Bananas has 26.9 more Per capita consumption in pounds than the lowest Fruits Cherries.
The Fruits Bananas has the highest Per capita consumption in pounds, followed by Apples, and Oranges. Down to the Fruits Cherries which is the lowest.
The Fruits Cherries has 3.27 times less Per capita consumption in pounds than average.
Summing up the values of all Fruitss, we get total 94.9.
